workflow.name: Automated Gmail classification and labeling with GPT-4, Sheets and Slack alerts
workflow.description:
## This n8n template automates email labeling using AI-enhanced classification and intelligent routing

Gmail users report spending significant time manually sorting email,¬†so this tool helps alleviate¬†that burden.

## How it works
- Gmail Trigger monitors unread emails every 2 minutes
- Once an email arrives, the content is extracted with HTML cleaning
- AI Agent (the node is set for Chat GPT-4) is used for classification & entity extraction
- A Structured Output Parser parses the email to JSON
- A 9-way category routing system categorizes the email (Inquiry, Support, Newsletter, Marketing, Personal, Urgent, Spam, Invoice, Meeting)
- Gmail auto-labeling is used for each category
- Google Sheets is used for logging (the main log that includes all emails and¬† an error log which are emails that cannot be classified)
- Slack alerts are generated for high-priority/urgent emails
- Error handling is done with separate error logging in Google Sheets

## How to use
- Set up credentials for Google Gmail, LLM (ChatGPT, Gemini, etc.), Google Sheets, and Slack
- Modify the categories as needed per user preference

## Requirements
- Gmail¬†
- Any LLM like ChatGPT or Google Gemini
- Google Drive with Google Sheets is optional for logging and error handling
- Slack is optional for high-priority messages

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "category": "Support Request",
  "priority": "High",
  "sentiment": "Urgent",
  "entities": {
    "names": ["John Doe"],
    "companies": ["Acme Corp"],
    "locations": ["San Francisco", "California"],
    "dates": ["2025-12-20"],
    "amounts": ["$1,500"],
    "phoneNumbers": ["+1-555-0123"],
    "urls": ["https://example.com"],
    "keywords": ["bug", "production", "database"]
  },
  "actionItems": ["Investigate database connection issue", "Provide ETA for fix"],
  "summary": "Customer reporting critical database connection bug in production environment"
}

options.systemMessage:
You are an email classification specialist AI assistant. Your task is to analyze incoming emails and provide structured classification with entity extraction.

CLASSIFICATION CATEGORIES (choose ONE):
- "Inquiry" - General questions or information requests
- "Support Request" - Technical issues, bugs, help needed
- "Newsletter" - Regular newsletters, digests, updates
- "Marketing" - Promotional emails, sales pitches, advertisements
- "Personal" - Personal correspondence, informal messages
- "Urgent" - Time-sensitive matters requiring immediate attention
- "Spam" - Unwanted or suspicious emails
- "Invoice/Receipt" - Financial documents, billing, payments
- "Meeting Request" - Calendar invitations, scheduling requests

PRIORITY LEVELS (choose ONE):
- "High" - Requires immediate action or response within 4 hours
- "Medium" - Should be addressed within 24 hours
- "Low" - Can be addressed at convenience

SENTIMENT (choose ONE):
- "Positive" - Friendly, appreciative, satisfied tone
- "Neutral" - Informational, matter-of-fact tone
- "Negative" - Frustrated, disappointed, complaint
- "Urgent" - Time-pressure, critical situation

ENTITY EXTRACTION:
Extract all relevant entities from the email:
- names: Full names of people mentioned
- companies: Company/organization names
- locations: Cities, states, countries
- dates: Dates mentioned (format: YYYY-MM-DD)
- amounts: Monetary amounts mentioned
- phoneNumbers: Phone numbers in any format
- urls: Web links or URLs
- keywords: 3-5 key technical terms or important words

ACTION ITEMS:
Identify specific tasks or requests from the email (list 1-5 items)

SUMMARY:
Provide a concise 1-2 sentence summary of the email content.

OUTPUT FORMAT:
Return a valid JSON object with all fields populated. If a field has no data, use empty array [] or empty string "".

EXAMPLES:

Good Classification:
{
  "category": "Support Request",
  "priority": "High",
  "sentiment": "Urgent",
  "entities": {
    "names": ["Sarah Johnson"],
    "companies": ["TechCorp"],
    "locations": ["New York"],
    "dates": ["2025-01-15"],
    "amounts": [],
    "phoneNumbers": [],
    "urls": ["https://app.techcorp.com"],
    "keywords": ["login", "error", "timeout"]
  },
  "actionItems": ["Fix login timeout error", "Test with user's account"],
  "summary": "Customer experiencing login timeout errors on production app"
}

Bad Classification (ambiguous):
{
  "category": "Maybe Support",
  "priority": "Kind of urgent",
  "sentiment": "Not sure"
}

ERROR HANDLING:
- If email content is unclear or too short, set category to "Inquiry" and priority to "Medium"
- Always return valid JSON with all required fields
- Do not include markdown formatting or code blocks in output

nodes.name: Check if High Priority or Urgent

parameters.content:
## 1. Email Ingestion
Gmail inbox checked every 2 minutes, email is parsed for agent.

## 2. AI Classification & Entity Extraction
Agent looks through classifications in "System Message" (Inquiry, Support, Newsletter, Marketing, Personal, Urgent, Spam, Invoice, Meeting). Parser validates response. High priority emails are sent to Slack.

## 3. Routing & Labeling
Switch node routes to 9 category-specific branches.
Each branch applies appropriate Gmail labels:
- Category label (e.g., üìß Support)
- Priority label (üî¥ High, üü° Medium, üü¢ Low)
- Sentiment label if negative/urgent

Urgent emails are starred automatically.

## 4. Error Handling & Logging
If classification fails:
- Email gets "Unclassified" category
- Logged to separate Error Log sheet
- Admin can manually review and reclassify
Google Sheets:
- Main log: All classified emails with full metadata
- Error log: Failed classifications for manual review

## 5. Slack Escalation
Slack alerts are generated for high-priority/urgent emails

## Classify Gmail with AI auto-labeler

This n8n workflow automates email classification in a Gmail inbox.

## How it works
1. **Gmail Intake:** A Gmail inbox is monitored for and scanned incoming emails.
2. **Classification and Extraction:** From the email the AI extracts category, priority, sentiment, etc. and parses the email. It also checks if it's high priority.
3. **Routing and Labeling:** Emails are labeled accordingly to user preferences.
4. **Error Handling and Logging:**  All emails are recorded in Google Sheets, and any emails that could not be labeled are flagged.  
5. **Slack Escalation:**  High priority emails are sent to a Slack channel

## Setup steps
- [ ] Connect **Gmail** account
- [ ] Connect **OpenAI Chat Model** and API key
- [ ] Connect **Slack** account
- [ ] Connect **Google Drive/Sheets** for logging

## Customization
1. Set up email classification categories in "System Message" of AI agent if needed
2. Change Code node to match any changes to the categories in the agent
2. Change labels on email categories on Gmail nodes to match

main.node: Check if High Priority or Urgent

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
